com.stickycoding.Rokon
Class TextureAtlas

java.lang.Object
  com.stickycoding.Rokon.TextureAtlas

public class TextureAtlas
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Richard Holds a collection of Texture's, organised so they can be stored as one texture on the hardware

Constructor Summary
TextureAtlas(int width, int height)
          Creates a TextureAtlas with specified width/height
TextureAtlas(int width, int height, TextureOptions textureOptions)
          Creates a TextureAtlas with specified width/height and non-standard TextureOptions
 
Method Summary
 int getHeight()
           
 TextureOptions getOptions()
           
 Texture[] getTextureArray()
           
 int getTextureIndex()
           
 int getWidth()
           
 void insert(Texture texture)
          Places a Texture onto the TextureAtlas, calculating the first place it will fit (starting from top left) If not used correctly (largest textures first) this is not the optimal method, you should precalculate and pass on coordinates It is recommended that you only use this for development, and then in your public release pass through all XY coordinates - speeding up greatly
 void insert(Texture texture, int x, int y)
          Places a Texture onto the TextureAtlas at given XY coordinates, it does not check whether this overlaps with any existing Texture's
 boolean isOnHardware()
           
 boolean isPowerOfTwo(int n)
           
 void select(GL10 gl)
          Selects this TextureAtlas on the hardware, does not call anything if it is already active
 void setOnHardware(boolean value)
          Flags whether this Atlas is currently loaded onto the hardware
 void setOptions(TextureOptions textureOptions)
          Gives the TextureAtlas specific TextureOptions, it will default to a standard mode If you are calling this, you must also use TextureManager.change to update the hardware
 void setTextureIndex(int index)
          Informs the TextureAtlas of what it's texture index on the hardware is
 Texture textureAt(int x, int y)

Constructor Detail

TextureAtlas

public TextureAtlas(int width,
                    int height)
Creates a TextureAtlas with specified width/height

Parameters:
width - pixel width of the TextureAtlas, must be power of 2
height - pixel height of the TextureAtlas, must be power of 2

                    int height,

Creates a TextureAtlas with specified width/height and non-standard TextureOptions

Parameters:
width - pixel width of the TextureAtlas, must be power of 2
height - pixel height of the TextureAtlas, must be power of 2
textureOptions -

Returns:

setOptions

public void setOptions(TextureOptions textureOptions)
Gives the TextureAtlas specific TextureOptions, it will default to a standard mode If you are calling this, you must also use TextureManager.change to update the hardware

Parameters:
textureOptions -

Returns:
the width, in pixels, of this TextureAtlas

the height, in pixels, of this TextureAtlas

public void select(GL10 gl)
Selects this TextureAtlas on the hardware, does not call anything if it is already active

getTextureIndex

public int getTextureIndex()
Returns:
the index at which the TextureAtlas is on the hardware, -1 if not set

public void setTextureIndex(int index)
Informs the TextureAtlas of what it's texture index on the hardware is

insert

public void insert(Texture texture,
                   int x,
                   int y)
Places a Texture onto the TextureAtlas at given XY coordinates, it does not check whether this overlaps with any existing Texture's

Parameters:
texture -
x -
y -

insert

public void insert(Texture texture)
Places a Texture onto the TextureAtlas, calculating the first place it will fit (starting from top left) If not used correctly (largest textures first) this is not the optimal method, you should precalculate and pass on coordinates It is recommended that you only use this for development, and then in your public release pass through all XY coordinates - speeding up greatly

Parameters:
texture -

textureAt

public Texture textureAt(int x,
                         int y)
Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:
the Texture currently occupying the given coordinates, NULL if empty
